intro: Daedalacanthus capensis, commonly known as the Cape daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, which bloom from spring to autumn. Daedalacanthus capensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant colors and adaptability to coastal environments.
